TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit URLConnection extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A connection to a URL for reading or writing.

remarks.para: A connection to a URL for reading or writing. For HTTP connections, see for documentation of HTTP-specific features.

URLConnection must be configured before it has connected to the remote resource. Instances of URLConnection are not reusable: you must use a different instance for each connection to a resource.
TimeoutsURLConnection supports two timeouts: a and a . By default, operations never time out.
Built-in Protocols
File
Resources from the local file system can be loaded using file: URIs. File connections can only be used for input.
FTP
File Transfer Protocol () is supported, but with no public subclass. FTP connections can be used for input or output but not both. By default, FTP connections will be made using anonymous as the username and the empty string as the password. Specify alternate usernames and passwords in the URL: ftp://username:password@host/path.
HTTP and HTTPS
Refer to the and subclasses.
Jar
Refer to the subclass.
Registering Additional Protocols Use to register handlers for other protocol types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Connect() cil managed

Docs.summary: Opens a connection to the resource.

remarks.para: Opens a connection to the resource. This method will not reconnect to a resource after the initial connection has been closed.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs while connecting to the resource.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ConnectAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
Specifies whether this URLConnection is already connected to the remote resource.

remarks.para: Specifies whether this URLConnection is already connected to the remote resource. If this field is set to true the flags for setting up the connection are not changeable anymore.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int ConnectTimeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the connect timeout in milliseconds.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the connect timeout in milliseconds. (See {#setConnectTimeout}.)

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the maximum time in milliseconds to wait while connecting. Connecting to a server will fail with a if the timeout elapses before a connection is established. The default value of 0 causes us to do a blocking connect. This does not mean we will never time out, but it probably means you'll get a TCP timeout after several minutes.
Warning: if the hostname resolves to multiple IP addresses, this client will try each in order. If connecting to each of these addresses fails, multiple timeouts will elapse before the connect attempt throws an exception. Host names that support both IPv6 and IPv4 always have at least 2 IP addresses.

Docs.summary: Returns an object representing the content of the resource this URLConnection is connected to.

remarks.para: Returns an object representing the content of the resource this URLConnection is connected to. First, it attempts to get the content type from the method getContentType() which looks at the response header field "Content-Type". If none is found it will guess the content type from the filename extension. If that fails the stream itself will be used to guess the content type.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs obtaining the content.

Docs.summary: Returns the content encoding type specified by the response header field content-encoding or null if this field is not set.

remarks.para: Returns the content encoding type specified by the response header field content-encoding or null if this field is not set.

Docs.summary: Returns the content length in bytes specified by the response header field content-length or -1 if this field is not set.

remarks.para: Returns the content length in bytes specified by the response header field content-length or -1 if this field is not set.

Docs.summary: To be added.
Returns the MIME-type of the content specified by the response header field content-type or null if type is unknown.

remarks.para: Returns the MIME-type of the content specified by the response header field content-type or null if type is unknown.

Docs.summary: Returns the timestamp when this response has been sent as a date in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT or 0 if this timestamp is unknown.

remarks.para: Returns the timestamp when this response has been sent as a date in milliseconds since January 1, 1970 GMT or 0 if this timestamp is unknown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool DoInput { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the option doInput which specifies whether this connection allows to receive data.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the value of the option doInput which specifies whether this connection allows to receive data.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the flag indicating whether this URLConnection allows input. It cannot be set after the connection is established.

Docs.exception: if this method attempts to change the value after the connection has been already established.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the flag indicating whether this URLConnection allows output. It cannot be set after the connection is established.

Docs.exception: if this method attempts to change the value after the connection has been already established.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Net.IFileNameMap FileNameMap { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the table which is used by all URLConnection instances to determine the MIME-type according to a file extension.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the table which is used by all URLConnection instances to determine the MIME-type according to a file extension.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the internal map which is used by all URLConnection instances to determine the MIME-type according to a filename extension.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Java.Lang.Object GetContent(class Java.Lang.Class[] types) cil managed

Docs.param: the list of acceptable content types.
Docs.summary: Returns an object representing the content of the resource this URLConnection is connected to.

remarks.para: Returns an object representing the content of the resource this URLConnection is connected to. First, it attempts to get the content type from the method getContentType() which looks at the response header field "Content-Type". If none is found it will guess the content type from the filename extension. If that fails the stream itself will be used to guess the content type. The content type must match with one of the list types.

Docs.exception: if an error occurs obtaining the content.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetHeaderField(int32 pos) cil managed

Docs.param: the field position of the response header.
Docs.summary: Returns the header value at the field position pos or null if the header has fewer than pos fields.

remarks.para: Returns the header value at the field position pos or null if the header has fewer than pos fields. The base implementation of this method returns always null.

Some implementations (notably HttpURLConnection) include a mapping for the null key; in HTTP's case, this maps to the HTTP status line and is treated as being at position 0 when indexing into the header fields.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetHeaderField(string key) cil managed

Docs.param: the name of the header field.
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the header field specified by key or null if there is no field with this name.

remarks.para: Returns the value of the header field specified by key or null if there is no field with this name. The base implementation of this method returns always null.

Some implementations (notably HttpURLConnection) include a mapping for the null key; in HTTP's case, this maps to the HTTP status line and is treated as being at position 0 when indexing into the header fields.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GuessContentTypeFromName(string url) cil managed

Docs.param: the URL with the filename to get the MIME type.
Docs.summary: Determines the MIME-type of the given resource url by resolving the filename extension with the internal FileNameMap.

remarks.para: Determines the MIME-type of the given resource url by resolving the filename extension with the internal FileNameMap. Any fragment identifier is removed before processing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GuessContentTypeFromStream(class System.IO.Stream is) cil managed

Docs.param: the resource representing input stream to determine the content type.
Docs.summary: Determines the MIME-type of the resource represented by the input stream is by reading its first few characters.

remarks.para: Determines the MIME-type of the resource represented by the input stream is by reading its first few characters.

Docs.exception: if an I/O error occurs while reading from the input stream.

Docs.summary: Returns an unmodifiable map of the response-header fields and values.

remarks.para: Returns an unmodifiable map of the response-header fields and values. The response-header field names are the key values of the map. The map values are lists of header field values associated with a particular key name.

Some implementations (notably HttpURLConnection) include a mapping for the null key; in HTTP's case, this maps to the HTTP status line and is treated as being at position 0 when indexing into the header fields.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long IfModifiedSince { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the point of time since when the data must be modified to be transmitted.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the point of time since when the data must be modified to be transmitted. Some protocols transmit data only if it has been modified more recently than a particular time.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the point of time since when the data must be modified to be transmitted. Some protocols transmit data only if it has been modified more recently than a particular time. The data will be transmitted regardless of its timestamp if this option is set to 0.

Docs.exception: if this URLConnection has already been connected.

Docs.summary: Returns an InputStream for reading data from the resource pointed by this URLConnection.

remarks.para: Returns an InputStream for reading data from the resource pointed by this URLConnection. It throws an UnknownServiceException by default. This method must be overridden by its subclasses.

Docs.exception: if no InputStream could be created.

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the response header field last-modified or 0 if this value is not set.

remarks.para: Returns the value of the response header field last-modified or 0 if this value is not set.

Docs.summary: Returns an OutputStream for writing data to this URLConnection.

remarks.para: Returns an OutputStream for writing data to this URLConnection. It throws an UnknownServiceException by default. This method must be overridden by its subclasses.

Docs.exception: if no OutputStream could be created.

Docs.summary: Returns a Permission object representing all needed permissions to open this connection.

remarks.para: Returns a Permission object representing all needed permissions to open this connection. The returned permission object depends on the state of the connection and will be null if no permissions are necessary. By default, this method returns AllPermission. Subclasses should overwrite this method to return an appropriate permission object.

Docs.exception: if an I/O error occurs while creating the permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int ReadTimeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the read timeout in milliseconds, or 0 if reads never timeout.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the read timeout in milliseconds, or 0 if reads never timeout.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the maximum time to wait for an input stream read to complete before giving up. Reading will fail with a if the timeout elapses before data becomes available. The default value of 0 disables read timeouts; read attempts will block indefinitely.

Docs.summary: Returns an unmodifiable map of general request properties used by this connection.

remarks.para: Returns an unmodifiable map of general request properties used by this connection. The request property names are the key values of the map. The map values are lists of property values of the corresponding key name.

Docs.param: the content factory to be set.
Docs.summary: Sets the internally used content handler factory.

remarks.para: Sets the internally used content handler factory. The content factory can only be set once during the lifetime of the application.

Docs.exception: if the factory has been already set.

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: The URL which represents the remote target of this URLConnection.

Docs.summary: Returns the URL represented by this URLConnection.

remarks.para: Returns the URL represented by this URLConnection.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool UseCaches { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Returns the value of the flag which specifies whether this URLConnection allows to use caches.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Returns the value of the flag which specifies whether this URLConnection allows to use caches.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the flag indicating whether this connection allows to use caches or not. This method can only be called prior to the connection establishment.

Docs.exception: if this method attempts to change the flag after the connection has been established.
